newsitem.title: FRANCE: SIDO raises French 96/97 soybean imports estimate.
newsitem.headline: SIDO raises French 96/97 soybean imports estimate.

text.p: French oilseeds and protein seeds association SIDO said on Monday it raised its estimate for 1996/97 soybean imports to 680,000 tonnes from a September target of 600,000 tonnes and 590,000 tonnes achieved in 1995/96.
In its November report SIDO put imports from non-EU countries at 650,000 tonnes against 570,000 tonnes forecast in September and 556,000 tonnes in 1995/96.
SIDO explained that France started the 1996/97 season with sharply lower than expected soybean stocks.
Carryover stocks at end June 1996 stood at 31,000 tonnes instead of the 94,000 tonnes SIDO estimated in September.
The carryover at end June 1997 was put at 51,000 tonnes.
France may harvest a soybean crop of 240,000 tonnes in 1996, down from 250,000 tonnes forecast in September and 260,000 tonnes produced in 1995.
SIDO linked the decline to a 15 percent fall in sowings to 85,000 hectares from 100,000 ha in 1995.
In September SIDO put 1996 sowings at 90,000 hectares.
It kept its estimate for 1996 yields unchanged from September at 2.8 tonnes per hectare. This would represent a jump of nine percent over 2.6 tonnes reached in 1995.
